relation: A category to classify the click.
Secondary ID to associate with the click (optional).
The workspace associated with the application (optional).
textBeforeTable: Table 13-2 COUNT_CLICK Parameters Table 13-2 describes the parameters available in the COUNT_CLICK procedure. Parameters p_company IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL); p_user IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, p_id IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, p_cat IN VARCHAR2, p_url IN VARCHAR2, HTMLDB_UTIL.COUNT_CLICK (  Syntax  This procedure counts clicks from an Oracle HTML DB application to an external site. You can also use the shorthand version procedure Z in place of HTMLDB_UTIL.COUNT_CLICK. COUNT_CLICK Procedure     END; HTMLDB_UTIL.CLEAR_USER_CACHE; BEGIN  Example  HTMLDB_UTIL.CLEAR_USER_CACHE;  Syntax  This procedure removes session state and application system preferences for the current user's session. Run this procedure if you reuse session IDs and want to run applications without the benefit of existing session state. CLEAR_USER_CACHE Procedure     END; HTMLDB_UTIL.CLEAR_APP_CACHE('100'); BEGIN  Example  The ID of the application for which session state will be cleared for current session. p_app_id Description Parameter
textAfterTable: Example BEGIN htp.p('Click here'); END; GET_FILE Procedure This procedure downloads files from the Oracle HTML DB file repository. Syntax HTMLDB_UTIL.GET_FILE ( p_file_id IN VARCHAR2, p_mime_type IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, p_inline IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'NO'); Parameters Table 13-3 describes the parameters available in GET_FILE procedure. Table 13-3 GET_FILE Parameters Parameter Description p_file_id ID in HTMLDB_APPLICATION_FILES of the file to be downloaded. p_mime_type Mime type of the file to download. p_inline Valid values include YES and NO. YES to display inline in a browser. NO to download as attachment. Example BEGIN HTMLDB_UTIL.GET_FILE( p_file_id => '8675309', p_mime_type => 'text/xml', p_inline => 'YES'); END;
